identificationModule.briefTitle: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation for Post-Cesarean Pain Control
identificationModule.officialTitle: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation for Post-Cesarean Pain Control

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Purpose of study is to evaluate the efficacy of transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) for post-operative pain control after a cesarean delivery compared to placebo and no TENS.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participants are randomized to one of three groups in parallel for the duration of the study

armGroups.label: Active TENS Unit
interventionNames: Device: Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) unit

armGroups.label: Placebo TENS Unit
interventionNames: Device: Placebo transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) unit

interventions.name: Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) unit
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to active TENS unit, placebo TENS unit, or no TENS unit

interventions.name: Placebo transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) unit
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to active TENS unit, placebo TENS unit, or no TENS unit

primaryOutcomes.description: Total postoperative narcotic consumption (measured in morphine equivalents)

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of cesarean delivery until discharge from hospital, assessed up to 1 month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain assessed by numeric analog scale (NAS) (0-10; 0: no pain at all, 10: worst imaginable pain)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On post-operative days 1, 2, 3, and day of discharge, assessed up to 1 month

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Satisfaction with pain control assessed by NAS (0-10; 0: very dissatisfied, 10: very satisfied)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: On post-operative days 1, 2, 3, and day of discharge, assessed up to 1 month
From date of randomization until date of discharge, assessed up to 1 month

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

- Women undergoing scheduled or non-urgent cesarean section

Exclusion Criteria:

* Non-English speaking
* Subjects with a history of chronic pain or chronic opioid use
* Pre-operative use of opioids for more than 1 week in the preceding 6 months
* Previous exposure to the TENS unit
* Women with an allergy or contraindication to narcotics/NSAIDs/acetaminophen
* Subjects who had a midline vertical skin incision during this operation
* Subjects who did not receive intrathecal opioids at the time of their cesarean delivery
* Adhesive allergies
* Subjects with a pacemaker (due to the unknown effects of the TENS on the electrical activity of the heart)
* Intraoperative general anesthesia
* Inability to consent to the study
* Postpartum tubal ligation
